content: of picot but right before finishing the stitch slide a bead up thread over and finish the stitch single_crochet in the last chain of the picot this is where you slip stitched to make the picot continue in this manner until your last picot finish off with a single_crochet in each of the next 3 stitches and finish off braids cut 3 lengths of yarn about 30 long 3 for each side if you are feeling reckless you can add more if you like with the right side of the scarf facing you insert your hook from back to front at one of the end points double your 3 strands so they form a loop in the middle place this loop over your hook and pull the loop through now take the strands and pull them through the loop and pull to tighten divide them up into 3 groups of 2 and braid until you have about 3 inches left make a knot and trim your tassel photo tutorial by dedri uys round 1 chain 6 photo 1 double_crochet in 5th chain from the hook indicated with an arrow in photo 1 and illustrated in photo 2 make a v st in the last chain indicated with an arrow in photo 2 ch2 photo 3 make 2 v st s in the same last chain photo 4 place your stitch marker in the chain-2 space photo 5 turn your work you should now have 4 v stitches and 1 chain-2 space photo 6 from here on out the v st chain-2 v st will be known as the corner round 2 chain 4 this counts as a double_crochet and chain 1 throughout the entire pattern -
